text:
Quiet, peaceful and cozy this place is perfect for book lovers that just one to have some quiet time alone in this quiet environment. Not only is this library used to read and borrow books, you can also bring your textbooks laptop phone here to do some revision or homework. There is also a variety of books that you can choose from. From comic books to novels and more. Highly recommended.

However it is a bit troublesome for people who drives. There is no waiting area and you have go 1 round to avoid blocking other drivers.

There is one Indian staff who is rude and has no patience to kids. She will show her unhappy face to the kids, not friendly at all. She even told my 5 -year old child that he is not allowed to borrow the books in the shelf of books for 10 years old. Absolute nonsense !

The library is not too crowded. The maximum duration you can stay is 2 hours continuous and if you want to stay longer, you need to check-out and check-in again due to Covid-19 safe distance measures which I believe is understandable.
The services are free of charge unless you need to borrow books. Their website has all the fee details if you need to get the membership.
Overall, it's a lovely place to study/ read with peace of mind!
Nice library to spend a whole day. It has different areas for kids and adults. Most of all, it is connected to the MRT station and Jurong Point Mall. Super convenient!
Tips : use the pedestrian overhead bridge ( located on the third level ) to have a smooth transition over to either Jurong point or Jurong bus interchange.
